p.s: in your last email you said, that you're thinking about spending a year in Germany after school.
I was really happy to hear that!
You also told me, that you heard that Berlin is the place to be.
As you know, I live in Cologne, so eventhougheven though I've been a few times in Berlin, I didn't really know how it is to lifelivetheirthere, especially as an English-speaking person like you.
So I did some research.
By doing that, I came across the article Berlin spricht Englisch by Marina Kormbaki, published in the local newspaper Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung, on 15th July 2016.

I thought this article could be very interesting for your question, because the author describes that speaking English is really popular in Berlin and also explains some other positive aspects about living there.

Kormbaki describes that Berlin gets more and more similar with big metropolesmetropolises like London, Brooklyn, Sydney, LA, etc., but in comparison to those cities, the livelife in Berlin seems to be much cheaper in amny different parts of life.
Not only the food, e.g. in cafés, is not as expensive as in the other cities, but also the rent is way lower.
Furthermore you can find in Berlin a variety of art, culture and nightlife, which means that you'll never be bored!
What's maybe also great for you, is, that many people in Berlin are speaking English, because there are coming diverse people from many different nations together.
In Berlin there are even some places, where people don't speak German, rather English, e.g. some stores and some Restaurantsrestaurants or café'scafés.
So I think in Berlin you wouldn't have to worry that you can't communicate with others.
There are even many English-speaking people in Berlin who were able to make their dreams come true, like starting their own business!
I hope I could help you with that information for your decision.
Let me know when you decided whether you want to go to Berlin or not.
I think, it would be really great!
If you do it, I promise you to visit you in Berlin and mabye you'd even like to visit me in Cologne someday.
Do you have any more questions about living in Germany?
I'm looking forward to hearing from you!
